alert.note: Alert for Kauai North; Kauai Southwest; Maui Central Valley North; Maui Windward West; Molokai North; Molokai West; Molokai Windward; Niihau; Oahu North Shore; Waianae Coast; Windward Haleakala (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued January 13 at 3:16PM HST until January 14 at 6:00PM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY FOR NORTH AND WEST FACING SHORES OF NIIHAU KAUAI OAHU AND MOLOKAI FOR NORTH FACING SHORES OF MAUI... .A large, reinforcing northwest swell will keep high surf along exposed north and west facing shores of the islands. Surf is expected to peak early this evening, then slowly decline, with elevated surf is expected to persist through Friday. Surf has declined below advisory level along west facing shores of the Big Island. ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM HST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Along north facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu, Molokai, and Maui, surf of 18 to 22 feet this evening...lowering to 14 to 18 feet by Friday morning. Along west facing shores of Niihau, Kauai, Oahu and Molokai, surf of 14 to 18 feet this evening, lowering to 10 to 15 feet by Friday morning. * WHERE...North and west facing shores of Kauai, Niihau, Oahu, and Molokai, and for north facing shores of Maui. * WHEN...Until 6 PM HST Friday. * IMPACTS...Moderate. Expect strong breaking waves, shore break, and strong longshore and rip currents making swimming difficult and dangerous.
info.instruction: Beachgoers, swimmers, and surfers should heed all advice given by ocean safety officials and exercise caution.
